sense.name: Flash intermittently; shine unsteadily
sense.examples: The lights flicked on and off. The power flicked on and off in the restrooms. The candle flicked in the darkness.

sense.name: Look quickly through a book or other written material.
sense.examples: He flicked through the report. She flicked through the volume.

sense.name: Move oneself/itself with a quick motion, possibly producing a sound.
sense.examples: Greg's eyes flicked up from his instrument panel. The paper flicked on the table from the air of the fan.

sense.name: Cause to move with a touch or blow; remove or toss an object, possibly producing a sound; cause light emission.
sense.examples: He flicked his bic. She flicked him with her hand. There was a sound like the one you produce when you flick a watermelon with your finger. He flicked the paper across the table. She flicked her fingers together.

sense.name: FLICK OFF: Gesture at as an insult.
sense.examples: She flicked off the rude cab driver. He flicked his wife off and stormed out the door.
